properties.name: 1369 Coffee House
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 1369 Cambridge St, Cambridge, MAThe original, smaller location for the 1369 coffee house. A bit more laid back than its Central Square counterpart. Good coffee, good baked goods, medium lighting, great location.

properties.name: 1369 Coffee House
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 757 Massachusetts Ave, Cambridge, MA1369 is one of the great independent coffee houses in Cambridge. The staff pretty much all have extreme body art (tattoos, piercings, etc.), the music is at the right volume (although is fairly out there - industrial, post-goth, punk, who knows?), and of course the coffee is delicious. Being close to MIT, they also have long power strips going down each wall. Wifi used to be free, but now they charge (the place can get pretty busy)

properties.name: Algiers Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  One day i went here with my knitting before going to a movie at the Brattle and 10 our of the 14 people in the part of the cafe I was in were also knitting. That was weird.

properties.name: Antoine's Pastry Shop
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 317 Watertown St, Newton, MAAntoine\'s is the local Italian pastry shop. Their cinnamon crescents are delicious. Also a good place to pick up a pie.

properties.name: Appetito
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 761 Beacon St, Newton, MANice, unpretentious Italian restaurant in Newton Center. The food is quite good, although the service is decidedly mixed.

properties.name: Applewood Inn
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 1001 El Camino Real, Menlo Park, CAPizzeria with a twist. Their garlic pizza will make you (and your significant other) cry. Some of the best pizza I\'ve ever had. A local favorite of the college crowd.

properties.name: Athan's Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 1621 Beacon St, brookline, maThe most authentic European bakery in Boston. They have fantastic baklava, gelato, chocolates (dark, milk, hazelnut), and "biscuits" (it seems wrong to call them cookies). Fairly small - only two or three tables, so they\'re mostly for retail business. Fantastic!

properties.name: Baker's Best
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar27 Lincoln Street, Newton, MA 02461Although they serve a nice lunch and Sunday brunch, they\'re really known for their catering. Excellent food, with mid-range prices.

properties.name: Belwood Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar  11625 Barrington Ct, Los Angeles, CA 90049Great pastries. Good coffee. The place the locals (including stars) stop to fill up in the morning. Not much seating. A great way to wake up in the morning.

properties.name: Blue Ribbon BBQ
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 1375 Washington St, Newton, MAThe best BBQ in Boston. No atmosphere (intentionally), down-home cooking. A smaller menu than, say, Redbones, but definitely delivers the goods. Has another location in Arlington.

properties.name: Blue Ribbon BBQ
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar908 Massachusetts Ave, Arlington, MAVery good BBQ. They have another location in Newton (which has a slight edge, in my opinion). No frills, excellent food.

properties.name: Blue state coffee
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar Lloyd Ave. and Brook St. providence, riNice leftie coffee place, with pastries from Seven Stars bakery. Sometimes hard to get a seat.

properties.name: Boston Rock Gym
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar  78 Olympia Ave # G, woburn, maAn OK rock gym. No frills.

properties.name: Burdicks
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar52 brattle st, cambridge, maGreat chocolatier, definitely the best place in town for a dark chocolate hot chocolate. Frequently hard to find a seat, but that\'s only to be expected. They also sell retail chocolate.

properties.name: Cafe Brazil
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar  421 Cambridge St, Allston, MAA mom-and-pop Brazilian restaurant. It has almost no atmosphere (unless you count the TV in the entry showing Brazilian news), but the food more than makes up for it. Inexpensive, but tough on the arteries. Lots of garlic might also be involved, so questionable as a date location. But it\'s goooood.

properties.name: Cafe Cakes
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar    51 Galen Street, Watertown, MA 02472A nice little cafe / bakery that moved to Watertown after their lease ran out in Belmont. They serve sandwiches, standard coffee house fare, and pastries, and also function as a retail cake shop. The owner and staff are Japanese, and some of the pastries reflect this. The blueberry and raspberry scones are delicious. There\'s free wifi, but no electrical outlets.

properties.name: Cafe Samovar
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar  236 Washington St, Brookline, MAAuthentic Russian food. Sits very heavily in the stomach, but if you\'re looking for blini with caviar, this is the place for you. Many different kinds of vodka, including their own home-made flavored kinds. The horseradish vodka was... enlightening.

properties.name: Cafe les Deux Moulins
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar  Filming location for the cafe scenes in Amelie (15 rue Lepic, at rue Cauchois). Not particularly notable otherwise, except that this area has a lot of great little stores, including patisseries, boulangeries, fromageries, flower shops, etc.

properties.name: Chinatown (Chuukagai)
properties.description: Posted by BratfarrarYokohama is a port city that used to be one of the major ports of entry for foreign ships. There is still a medium-sized Chinatown here, where you can buy meat buns on the street, or visit one of the many restaurants.

properties.name: Creperie
properties.description: Posted by BratfarrarI don\'t know what this little creperie is called, but it does one thing (crepes) and it does it well. A little off the beaten path, not very well known, but worth a shot if it\'s late and you\'re looking for something other than ice cream.

properties.name: Deluxe Town Diner
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 627 Mount Auburn St, Watertown, MA A really good diner. Not a greasy spoon, but they\'ve got the best pancakes I\'ve every had (and I\'m not generally into pancakes). Get there early on Sunday or you\'ll be waiting a half hour - the locals usually arrive in force.

properties.name: Dirt Cowboy Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 7 S Main St, Hanover, NHFantastic coffee house. Great baked goods. Excellent coffee. Good vibe. \'Nuff said.

properties.name: Doylestown Rock Gym
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar  3853 Old Easton Rd, Doylestown, PA 18901Rock gym much more oriented towards kids than adults. A good place for a kindergarten or grade school party, but for adult climbers it\'s a bit too small.

properties.name: Embassy Cinema
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar  18 Pine St, Waltham, MAGood theater with a mix of first run and art films.

properties.name: Extraordinary Desserts
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar  2929 5th Ave, san diego, caThe place is named appropriately - it\'s a phenomenal bakery/dessert place. Hands down the best place to bring a date in San Diego. There is always a line out the door, and I have never heard anyone complain (in general, people just kind of smile at each other and whisper about how it\'s always like this). Go. Now.

properties.name: Finale
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar1306 Beacon Street, brookline, maFinale is one of the "nicer" dessert places in town, which means that you can choose between a dozen different dessert wines and ports to go with your molten chocolate torte. It\'s also open late (11:30-12:30), which is nice in a part of town where everything seems to close at 10. Finale has two other locations - one in Harvard Sq, the other in the theater district. The thing about Finale is that it\'s actually kind of boring. The desserts are good, but it feels kind of bland. It isn\'t cozy, or quaint, or cute, or idiosyncratic, or cool. But if you\'re looking for a late night fix in Brookline, it\'s probably your best bet.

properties.name: Formaggio Kitchen
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar244 Huron Ave, Cambridge, MAProbably the best gourmet food store in Boston. Divided into three sections, the left-most has a huge selection of cheese, which they will let you sample. The central section is an assortment of chocolates and other assorted gourmet treats. And the right-most is a gourmet grocer. It\'s small, and (to my mind) the cheese section is the real reason to go.

properties.name: French Press Coffee
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar   2201 Commonwealth Ave, Brighton, MA 02135Reasonably good coffee, and ice cream. Popular with the nearby Boston College kids. Can get pretty busy. Free wifi.

properties.name: Fukuhime Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 17905 S Western Ave, Gardena, CAA really wonderful izakaya (Japanese pub). Be sure to go with someone who reads Japanese, because most of the menu items haven\'t been translated into English. It\'s that kind of place. The only downside is that it\'s a bit close to Compton, which might be a safety concern.

properties.name: Gaffney's Wine Bar
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar897 S Coast Hwy 101, Encinitas, CA 92024Unassuming, low-key wine bar. Not the biggest selection, but it\'s a fun place to hang out, and the hosts are pretty down-to-earth.

properties.name: Garden of Eden
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 571 Tremont St, Boston, MAAn upscale restaurant / bakery / coffee house - honestly, I\'ve never tried the food, but the desserts are divine. A great place for a date.

properties.name: Hurry Curry of Tokyo
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar2131 Sawtelle Blvd, Los Angeles, CAWe used to go here for lunch all the time. It was good, cheap Japanese curry (*very* different from Indian curry), served very quickly.

properties.name: IKEA
properties.description: Posted by BratfarrarThe IKEA mothership. Strangely, cash doesn\'t seem to be allowed - only credit cards.

properties.name: Ichiban Sushi & Japanese
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar336 S 400 E, Salt Lake City, UT 84111A reasonably good sushi restaurant. A large, full-service restaurant, which used to be owned by one of the first western women to learn to make sushi in Japan. A safe choice if you feel cravings, but not worth a special trip.

properties.name: Indian Dhaba
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 180 Brighton Av, Allston, MA, 02134Indian Dhaba

properties.name: Ishikawa-cho
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar A more relaxed (last time I was there!) shopping district with a lot of nice shops. Everything from trinkets to art galleries. A fun way to spend an afternoon

properties.name: Jewell and the Beanstalk
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar  793 Somerville St, Manchester, NHFun little cafe / restaurant. Good place for brunch, but they also have chocolates, baked goods, etc. They used to have a hair salon in the back (!), but evidently they\'re turning that into an office for the web designer husband of one of the owners. Good local joint, nice place to hang - closes a little early.

properties.name: La Piazza Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar   286 Moody St, Waltham, MACoffee house with ice cream and sandwiches. A nice, low-key place to spend a couple of minutes before or after a movie at the Embassy Theater around the corner.

properties.name: Lala Rokh
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 97 Mt Vernon St, Boston, MA 02108Home-style Persian cuisine. Not as much the kebab fare that you will find elsewhere, but lots of slow-cooking simmering dishes such as kashk-bademjan and other extremely yummy things. Very nice date restaurant (moderately expensive). Underwriter for WBUR.

properties.name: Landmark Tower
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar At one point, the tallest building in Japan. Lots of shopping and food.

properties.name: Les Zygomates
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar Boston, MARestaurant with good wine list. Many wines by the glass (over 40?). The French food is good, but the reason to go is for the Tuesday night wine tastings. 0 (including tip) for a flight of four wines from a particular region/varietal/etc., a description by the flamboyant sommelier, and a cooking demonstration by the chef/owner. A very good date. They have one tasting at 6, another at 8. They have live music most nights.

properties.name: Lincoln Street Coffee
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar  15 Lincoln Street, Newton Highlands, MA 02461Medium-sized independent coffee house, with some nice lunch options (grilled sandwiches a la francaise). Live music every Friday night. The lighting is a little low for hanging out and reading, but overall a nice place to hang out.

properties.name: Locanda Veneta
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 8638 W 3rd St, Los Angeles, CAGood Italian restaurant, with occasional star sightings (I saw Sigourney Weaver there :). Very nice food, good atmosphere.

properties.name: Matsuhisa
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar129 N La Cienega Blvd, beverly hills, caThe best sushi I\'ve ever had (even after living in Japanese for 3 1/2 years). Not just top quality fish, but inventive means of presentation. The founder (Nobu Matsuhisa) has expanded to other locations (notably, Nobu in Manhattan), but this is The Place.

properties.name: MetroRock
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 69 Norman St, everett, maReasonably good rock climbing gym.

properties.name: Mike's Pastries
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar300 Hanover St, Boston, MaOne room filled from floor to ceiling with bread, cake, cannolis and every other imaginable form of pastry. It\'s become a bit too popular for it\'s own good, I think (the locals are sick of the out-of-towners), but it\'s hard to argue with their chocolate-dipped cannolis.

properties.name: Mission Cliffs Rock Climbing
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 2295 Harrison St, san francisco, caAn awesome rock gym. Good facilities, a wide variety of walls. Some routes are easily two and a half times as high as at other facilities. A great rock climbing gym.

properties.name: Modern Pastry Shop
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 257 Hanover Street, Boston, MAIt just got a facelift, but "The Modern" is the no-frills answer to Mike\'s across the street. They fill your cannolis while you wait, so that it doesn\'t have a chance to get soggy. Most Bostonians will have an opinion on whether Mike\'s or The Modern is better, and the only appropriate response is to see for yourself.

properties.name: Oga's Japanese Cuisine
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 915 Worcester Rd, Natick MAVery good Japanese restaurant. They have many items on the menu you wouldn\'t expect to find (nasu dengaku, for one), and everything is well prepared. Good, solid restaurant.

properties.name: Oishii Sushi
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar612 Hammond St, Chestnut Hill, MAThe best sushi in Boston. Sadly, also the most difficult place to get into. It\'s small, there are no reservations, and you can\'t put your name on the list and then come back in an hour - they check to make sure that you\'re still there! You can easily wait a couple of hours to get in. You can also order take-out, which is what most people do. Reasonably expensive.

properties.name: Paris Creperie
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar278 Harvard St, brookline, maGood crepes (both savory and sweet), not much seating. Don\'t try and get an espresso drink - it will take ten minutes, and will taste like grounds.

properties.name: Piattini
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 226 Newbury Street Boston, MAMediterranean restaurant with lots of wine by the glass. Go for the appetizers instead of the main courses (why is that true of most restaurants these days?), and sip your wine with a friend or date while watching the mix of trendy and trashy Newbury Street shoppers and tourists go by.

properties.name: Pomodoro
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 319 Hanover St, Boston, MAOne of the best places for Italian food in the North End (fighting words, I know). Not because they have the finest food, or the most extensive wine list (you can only get a glass of the house red), but because it has a great, comfortable atmosphere, good, solid food, and no pretension.

properties.name: Punjab
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 473 Massachusetts Ave, Arlington, MAVery good Indian restaurant.

properties.name: Punjab Food and Spices
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 454 Massachusetts Ave, Arlington, MAAn Indian grocer notable for two reasons - first, that it serves Indian appetizers. Second, that they will make you a cup of delicious piping hot chai. The real stuff.

properties.name: Punjabi Dhaba Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 225 Hampshire St, Cambridge, MAInexpensive Indian food. A step above fast food, a step below normal restaurants (the owners also run Punjab in Arlington), a local favorite that\'s generally pretty busy. Good for a quick fix.

properties.name: Ramen Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar I don\'t know if it\'s still there, but there used to be the most amazing ramenya here. Their specialty was "tsukemen" - ramen dipped in broth (instead of served inside it). They also had the "jumbo ramen challenge" - if you could eat a jumbo bowl in 30 minutes, you could get your name on the wall, and the ramen would be free. I failed.

properties.name: Rami's
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar324 Harvard St, Brookline, MAKosher falafel/shawarma joint. Very good baba ganouj, friendly staff, fast service, good falafel. Inexpensive.

properties.name: Restaurant Au Pressoir
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar Located at 257 Ave Daumesnil in Paris, right next to the Michez Bizot metro station, this is a great, old-fashioned French restaurant. Great service, great wine, great food. My parents\' favorite place in Paris, and I\'m inclined to agree. It will set you back a bit.

properties.name: Rodin Sculpture Garden
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar Stanford University has the second largest Rodin collection in the world (after the Rodin museum in Paris). There are a number of sculptures scattered around the campus (the Thinker, the Burghers of Calais, etc.), but most are in this one location.

properties.name: Route 7 Grill
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 999 main street, great barrington, maUnbelievably yummy BBQ. The beef ribs melt in your mouth. The baked beans (not normally a gourmet item) are divine. They use a mix of locally produced and organic ingredients, but the prices are pretty reasonable. These guys are foodies, and it shows.

properties.name: Rubinov's
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar A great little coffee house / bakery. Locally owned. I think that the latte I had here might very well be the best latte I\'ve ever had. Yes, it was that good.

properties.name: Seven Stars Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar  Providence, RIGood local bakery, with various loaves (including seasonal specials, like pumpkin seed sourdough) and pastries. Also have reasonably good lattes.

properties.name: Shawarma King
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 1383 Beacon Street, Brookline, MALebanese fast food restaurant. Great shawarma roll ups, baba ganouj, hummus. Very inexpensive, but quite delicious.

properties.name: Simon's Coffee House
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar  1736 Massachusetts Ave, Cambridge, MA 02138A smallish coffee house on Mass Ave, halfway between Porter and Harvard Squares. Somewhat narrow, good atmosphere, good indie coffee buzz.

properties.name: Solid Rock Climbing Gym
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar  2074 Hancock St, San Diego, CAReasonably good climbing gym. A little cut-rate. This gym has several other locations in the area, but this (at least last time I went) was the better location.

properties.name: Solid Rock Climbing Gym
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar  992 Rancheros Dr, San Marcos, CA 92069A reasonably good climbing gym, but nothing special. The San Diego location is preferable. There\'s a new Poway location, but I haven\'t been there, and don\'t know how good it is.

properties.name: Tacos Lupita
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 13 Elm St, somerville, maSalvadoran fast food restaurant - not that fancy, but a good place to get pupusas and guaraches. Inexpensive, good.

properties.name: Tango
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 464 Massachusetts Ave, Arlington, MAArgentinian restaurant. As you would expect, the steak is delicious, and they put this fantastic chimichuri sauce on it... Anyway, I don\'t eat beef often, but when I splurge, this is where I go. Good place for a date, or to meet a bunch of friends. Good atmosphere.

properties.name: Taste
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar   311 Walnut St, Newtonville, MA 02460Taste is a cafe / creperie / gelateria (Toscanini\'s) / coffee house / lunch place. It also serves wine, and has the distinction of being open until 10 PM most (all?) nights, which is highly unusual for Newton. Hard to classify. Food is OK, but not special.

properties.name: Thai Thai Kitchen
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar Small, fast Thai food. Surprisingly good, given the speed. They\'re known for having very spicy dishes (the so-called "wild curry" is, um, mind-expanding). Inexpensive lunches.

properties.name: The Wine Lover
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar3968 5th Ave., San Diego, CAAn upscale wine bar, with a good selection of wines. The standard assortment of cheese and olives, as well as some entrees which, to my knowledge, no one has ever ordered (well, OK, that\'s probably not true, but it\'s definitely not why you go).

properties.name: The WineSellar and Brasserie
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar   9550 Waples Street, San Diego, CaOne of the fine restaurants of San Diego. Located at the back of a building in an industrial park in the middle of nowhere (seriously). Downstairs they have a retail wine store with very knowledgeable staff, and upstairs they have haute French cuisine. Also, you can choose a bottle of wine (from downstairs) with your dinner at a mere 20% markup! (most restaurants will mark up a bottle %100-200 over the retail price).

properties.name: Three Sisters
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar  Providence, RIIce cream / lunch / coffee house. Coffee is not great, but it\'s a good atmosphere in a nice area next to a park, with homemade ice cream. Good sandwiches, too.

properties.name: Tip Top Meats & European Deli
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 6118 Paseo Del Norte, Carlsbad, CA 92009The best butcher in North County, San Diego. Possibly in all of San Diego. There\'s a definite Teutonic atmosphere, and you might want to avoid some of the breakfast specials (the all-you-can-eat meat special will take years off of your life), but this is the place to go if you have a need for some obscure cut of meat, or German beer.

properties.name: Tokyo Jewish Community Center
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar JCC in the middle of Tokyo. Nice facilities, including a beautiful sanctuary, library, pool, etc. The services tend to be conservadox (they have to cater to everyone, but the people who show up are generally on the more religious side). As usual, Friday night is more social, and Saturday morning more religious.

properties.name: Tombo
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 2106 Artesia Blvd, Torrance, CAJapanese okonomiyaki restaurant. Not something you see in the US much (ever?), but this is a good restaurant to go to if you\'re looking to see the real deal. Kind of like a Japanese combination of omelette, souffle, and pizza, which you cook yourself. Not what you would call haute cuisine, but fun for a group.

properties.name: Troquet
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar  140 Boylston St, Boston, MAUpscale French bistro with a great wine list, and many wines by the glass. Expensive. Right next to the theater district, so well situated for a night out on the town. Of particular note - the cheese tray was fantastic.

properties.name: U-Zen Japanese Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 11951 Santa Monica Blvd, Los Angeles, CAExcellent sushi. Very fresh. Friendly staff. They also have a number of unusual dishes. Very good value for the price.

properties.name: Vertical Hold Sport Climbing Center
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar9580 Distribution Ave, san diego, caBest rock climbing gym in San Diego. I would classify this as very good, but not great. Good amenities.

properties.name: Vilna Shul
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar18 Phillips St, Boston, MAOtherwise known as Havurah on the Hill, they only have one service per month, but there are usually 200 or so 20-30 somethings attending. Always a speaker, and food afterwards. They\'re in the midst of restoring the shul, so the building isn\'t in the best of shape, but it\'s a good time. Conservative egalitarian.
